text:
Raskolnikov walked beside the man in silence. 

“You were inquiring for me … of the porter?” he asked quietly. 

The man didn’t answer. 

“Why do you … come and ask for me … and say nothing?” 

The man raised his eyes, a sinister look on his face. 

“Murderer!” he said clearly. 

Raskolnikov felt weak. A cold shiver ran down his spine. 

“What do you mean … who is a murderer?” he muttered. 

“You are a murderer,” the man replied, smiling with triumph. 

They reached the cross-roads. The man turned away.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov encounters a man who accuses him of being a murderer, intensifying his feelings of guilt and fear.
